intro: Cladocolea stricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow ray flowers surrounded by disk flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Cladocolea stricta is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
